ftbquests.abydos.world.description: I hope the sand doesn't get in your machines.
ftbquests.abydos.world.subtitle: One step closer to home...
ftbquests.abydos.world.title: A new world!
ftbquests.abydos.zalloy_ingot.descriptio: The core component for crafting all components for §4UHV§r.
ftbquests.abydos.cyclonic_sifter.descrip: A new machine that can find treasures among the rubble.
ftbquests.abydos.cyclonic_sifter.title: 1st §4§oUltimate§r Multiblock
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_computational_matri: A small computer that can regulate mechanisms.
ftbquests.abydos.folding_akreyrium_stabi: This machine mixes a liquid with 2 catalysts to put it in a more activated form.
ftbquests.abydos.more_ultimate_multibloc: With these 2 machines you can massively increase the amount of Akreyrium you produce.
ftbquests.abydos.utopian_akreyrium.descr: A weird fluid, that has some interesting properties making it necessary for more advanced machines.
ftbquests.abydos.utopian_akreyrium.title: Utopian Akreyrium
By inputting a bacteria you are able to breed then so they multiply and get mutated copies so you can try to find the exact rates you are looking for. Higher mutability means more variance in its output.
ftbquests.abydos.bacterial_hydrocarbon_h: This is how you can extract the bacteria to get the resources you desire
ftbquests.abydos.bacterial_runic_mutator:
This machine can do 3 things.

1. Reactivate the Dormant Bacteria to a usable form
2. Mutate bacteria so that it may have a new affinity
3. Mutate bacteria so that it may be a new type

With all of this and the breeder (more information there) you should be able to get the exact type of bacteria you desire.
ftbquests.abydos.temples.description:
Go Explore the Scattered Temples of Abydos to find the things you are searching for.

You might even find a §ltalisman§r powerful enough to stop the sands of Abydos from eroding you...
ftbquests.abydos.temples.title: Scattered Temples
ftbquests.abydos.bacteria_dormant.descri: A bacteria that is in a dormant state. Why was this stored with treasures?
ftbquests.abydos.bacteria_dormant.title: Otherworldly Biology
ftbquests.abydos.bacteria.description: Awoken Bacteria. These come in all kinds of types and seem to produce some familiar liquids.
ftbquests.abydos.bacteria.title: Bacterial Colonies
Find all the fragments to uncover hidden knowledge
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_transmission_assemb: A mechanism that can create rotation with large amounts of force.
ftbquests.abydos.runic_tablet_complete.d: Soon more advanced technology is unveiled
ftbquests.abydos.ancient_runicalium_ingo: A new Stellarium alloy mixed with materials not normally found on your home isle.
ftbquests.abydos.ancient_runicalium_wire:
The §2UEV§r superconductor, can hold 256 amps in a 1x wire.

This is the §l§nFINAL§r superconductor of this type.
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_auxiliary_boosted_f:
A Fusion Reactor that can do parallels. Long gone are the days of excessive Fusion spam, now all you need to do is figure out how to efficiently wallshare these.

Auxiliary Fusion Reactors are special in that they can parallel using §6Absolute §3Parallel§r hatches. (Placed on the interior side of the controller)
ftbquests.abydos.exotic_gas_siphon.descr: This beauty can harvest colossal amounts of air at once and automatically distill it. Without a doubt, this multiblock is a must for getting to the Ancient Gate.
ftbquests.abydos.ancient_stargate_comput: A computer that can read data from a Draconic Coordinate Core.
ftbquests.abydos.ancient_stargate_base_b:
The core of an Ancient Stargate.

This can accurately detect and use Chevrons to lock on planets far beyond Abydos.
ftbquests.abydos.ancient_stargate_ring_b:
And here we go again, more Ring Blocks

Though this time, much stronger
ftbquests.abydos.ancient_stargate_chevro: These Chevrons can lock in coordinates with far more precision then the previous generation.
ftbquests.abydos.ancient_chevron_disk.de: A Chevron that can hold data for more advanced destinations.
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_precision_drive_mec: A mechanism that can do precise movements with directives.
ftbquests.abydos.gate_assembly.descripti: So this is what makes the Gates Beyond Comprehension....
ftbquests.abydos.draconic_coordinate_cor: A core with the ability to find the smallest and largest traces of planets all over the Galaxy
ftbquests.abydos.nether_coordinate_cryst: The path to the hellfires of the Nether, inscribed on a piece of whispering gemstone.
The path to the shattered void of the End, inscribed on a piece of whispering gemstone.
ftbquests.abydos.milky_way_stargate.desc:
The gateway to the cold and lifeless abyss, and the burning fires of hell.



§oJust a recommendation, but don't take any valuable items with you the first time.
ftbquests.abydos.ethylbenzene.descriptio: Mutate and Breed Bacteria to fit your needs and help you gather all the hydrocarbons you could need.
ftbquests.abydos.ethylbenzene.title: Cheaper HydroCarbons
ftbquests.abydos.void_core.description: A core that can detect the smallest amounts of matter inside the vast nothingness of space.
ftbquests.abydos.hell_core.description: A core that can feel the immense energy of burning flames all across the galaxy.
ftbquests.abydos.data_dna_disk.descripti: This data disk can store so much data that you could put all human DNA in it.
ftbquests.abydos.zalloy_coil.description: The new tier of coils in Abydos, so get ready to replace your old ones.
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_microfluidic_flow_v: A valve that can measure the tiniest amounts of fluid and accurately dose them.
ftbquests.abydos.uepic_chip.description: Another tier of PIC Wafers, used for some incredible Abydos technology.
ftbquests.abydos.uepic_chip.title: UEPIC Chips
ftbquests.abydos.runic_casings.descripti: Runes engraved on blocks to allow for them to exert power on placed blocks.
ftbquests.abydos.runic_casings.title: Runic Engraved Casings
ftbquests.abydos.multi_runic_plating.des: Multi-layered runes, carrying the power of all that went into crafting them.
ftbquests.abydos.runic_inscribe_manipula: A machine that can engrave runes on top of each other using lost Abydos technology.
ftbquests.abydos.runic_plating.title: Advanced Engraved Runes
ftbquests.abydos.classic_chevron_assembl: An array of Chevrons that can store more complex data.
ftbquests.abydos.gritty_akreyrium.descri: You can drill this up just like Oil.
ftbquests.abydos.gritty_akreyrium.title: Gritty Akreyrium
ftbquests.abydos.nanofluidic_heat_sink.d: A passive Heat Sink with actual good cooling.
ftbquests.abydos.positioner.title: Positioner
ftbquests.abydos.inscribe_casing.descrip: The Maker of Gates applauds you and bestows upon you their recognition.
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_parallel_hatch.desc: Ok now these rates are getting insane
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_absolute_parallel_h:
Remember how regular §3Parallel§r hatches are complex and care about maxing out amperage and your overclocks. Ya forget all of that it's just that many more of a recipe at once.

(Only goes on special machines, does §4NOT§r replace your normal parallel hatch)
ftbquests.abydos.radon.description:
By using the Exotic Gas Siphon you can do all of Air Distillation in 1 step.

Furthermore you are able to collect airs from exotic dimensions.
ftbquests.abydos.radon.title: Cheaper Gases
ftbquests.abydos.nether_armor.descriptio: Scans indicate that the Nether is an inhospitable dimension due to intensive radioactive decay. This armor will help mitigate the effects. The Nether inhabitants might be hiding a §ltalisman§r capable of nullifying the effects of radiation...
ftbquests.abydos.nether_armor.title: Runic Infused Hazmat Armor
ftbquests.abydos.magma_processing.descri: More information present in the Processing Lines (4,5,6) Chapter
ftbquests.abydos.magma_processing.title: Magma Processing
ftbquests.abydos.molten_destabilizer.des: These Magmas need to a little more to break down.
ftbquests.abydos.abyss_fragment.descript:
A shard of the §5§l§o§mAbyss§r

Forged from echoes of a void and altered stars

It must be at the heart of something strong
ftbquests.abydos.inferno_fragment.descri:
A shard of the §4§l§o§mInferno§r

Forged from blinding flames and altered stars

It must be at the heart of something strong
ftbquests.abydos.empty_coordinate_core.d: Used to contain powers just within comprehension.
ftbquests.abydos.abyssal_stargate_rod.de:
A refined Stargate Rod, infused with the power of the §5§o§lAbyss§r. Refined over and over.

Alone it is able to rip tears in the fabric of the endless void.
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_catalyst_core.descr: A sturdy core that can precisely regulate its inner working environment.
ftbquests.abydos.infernal_stargate_rod.d:
A refined Stargate Rod, infused with the power of the §4§o§lInferno§r. Refined over and over.

Alone it holds enough power to burn through the fabric of space
ftbquests.abydos.untreated_abyssal_starg: A Stargate Rod infused with the power of the §5§oAbyss§r, though not yet refined
ftbquests.abydos.untreated_infernal_star: A Stargate Rod infused with the power of the §4§oInferno§r, though not yet refined
ftbquests.abydos.bulk_ore_processing_arr:
Have you ever wanted to process millions of items at once?

Well now you can.
ftbquests.abydos.singularities.title: Advanced Singularities
ftbquests.abydos.ruined_components.descr:
Ruined Component Parts can be found as loot in various structures in Abydos.

By finding these ancient parts of technology and researching them, you can discover how to advance into §4UHV§r technology.
ftbquests.abydos.ruined_components.title: Ruined Component Parts
ftbquests.abydos.abydos_talisman.descrip: A way to bypass the needs of armor, a blessing of sorts.
ftbquests.abydos.cartouche.title: Buried Tombs
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_high_strength_panel: A sturdy plating that can resist wear and tear from high stress machinery.
ftbquests.abydos.naquadah_armor.descript: Not much use on their own but they may hold the secret to stronger things
ftbquests.abydos.naquadah_armor.title: Ancient Armors
ftbquests.abydos.abydos_alloys.descripti: Amalgamations of the various byproducts you get from Magma Processing
ftbquests.abydos.abydos_alloys.title: Abydos Alloys
ftbquests.abydos.neutronium_silicon_carb: Only the strongest of coil insulators
ftbquests.abydos.zirconium_ingot.descrip:
A super strong neutron absorber.

§7§oRemember that EBFs gain heat for every tier above §bMV§7 meaning Tritanium Coils can handle it [§c11400K§7 at UV].
ftbquests.abydos.oneiric_relay.descripti: A wireless node with even larger area of impact.
ftbquests.abydos.lucinducer.description: A way to copy the dream network your machines are on
ftbquests.abydos.ancient_refinement_cent: A machine capable of combining all the resource generation you needed.
ftbquests.abydos.uhv_micropower_router.d: A controller that can precisely regulate energy transfer.
ftbquests.abydos.title: Adventures in Abydos
ftbquests.ae2.cell_housings.title: Cell Housings
ftbquests.ae2.me_buses.title: GregTech ME hatches
ftbquests.ae2.infinity_cells.title: Infinity Cells
ftbquests.ae2.processors.title: Processors
ftbquests.ae2.printed_circuits.title: Printed Circuits
ftbquests.ae2.me_assembler.title: ME Assembler
ftbquests.ae2.skystone_alloys.title: Skystone Alloys
ftbquests.ae2.cheaper_cores.title: Cheaper Cores
ftbquests.ae2.large_me_assembler.title: Large ME Assembler
ftbquests.ae2.quantum_linking.title: Quantum Network Bridge
ftbquests.ae2.terminals.description:
Terminals allow you to see what is happening inside your network, and interact with it.

We recommend instantly upgrading to a crafting terminal, as they are extremely convenient.
ftbquests.ae2.terminals.title: ME Terminals
ftbquests.ae2.autocrafting.description:
Patterns are the key to autocrafting with AE2.

They store the recipes that you want to craft, and when you put them in a pattern provider, AE2 will see how to craft that item.
ftbquests.ae2.autocrafting.title: AE2 Autocrafting
ftbquests.ae2.ex_export_import_bus.title: ME Extended Import/Export Bus
ftbquests.ae2.extended_machines.title: Extended Machines
ftbquests.ae2.positioner.title: positioner
ftbquests.ae2.assembler_matrix.title: Assembler Matrix
ftbquests.ae2.mega_component_skip.title: 1M Mega Storage Component Skip
ftbquests.ae2.mega_component_skip.descri: Now that you have access to LuV circuits, you can craft 1M components with a cheaper recipe.
ftbquests.ae2.title: Applied Energistics
ftbquests.automation_age.micro_processor:
This is a cheaper §6HV§r circuit.

Better get used to it, as it will take a little bit until you can get better ones.
ftbquests.automation_age.industrial_barr: A §oBIG§r barrel that can scale with your power allowing you to barrel even harder.
ftbquests.automation_age.pyrolysed_oil.d: Heavy Oil can alternatively be made in a Pyrolyse Oven
ftbquests.automation_age.carbon_fibers.d: Carbon and a Plastic. Each Plastic gives twice as much Fibers as the previous one.
ftbquests.automation_age.borosilicate_gl: Just some Glass and Boron, quite cheap.
ftbquests.automation_age.super_ebf.descr:
A Boosted EBF.....

Oh yeah this is where it's at

Wait what do you mean it can only have 1 energy hatch?
Large Variants of nearly all of the single blocks they allow you to overclock some machines you couldn't prior.

Also capable of using parallel hatches, something you'll get familiar with soon.
ftbquests.automation_age.twinite_wire.de: &dLuV&r superconductor, can hold 64 amps in a 1x cable.
ftbquests.automation_age.super_electric_: A Boosted Electric Ore Factory which allows you to break down your ores at an even more accelerated rate.
ftbquests.automation_age.micro_processor: The new §6HV§r circuit can be upgraded into an §5EV§r circuit, allowing you to make upgrades to all your machines.
ftbquests.automation_age.cpu_chip.title: CPU Chips
ftbquests.automation_age.plastic_circuit: Better Circuits means better Circuit boards
ftbquests.automation_age.maintenance_hat:
§6Auto Maintenance Hatch§r: Ever worry about needing maintenance, well now you never have to.

§3Configurable Maintenance Hatch§r: Make your machines faster at the sake of risking more maintenance issues, or make them slower to reduce the chance.

§4§lSpecial Notes§r:
Maintenance hatches will always check if they incur maintenance which can take a toll on your game's performance at scale. Auto Maintenance Fixes this concern.

Alternatively the Configurable Maintenance can range from .9x time to 1.1x time. Meaning you can either add/subtract 10%% from a recipe time. Reducing long recipe times is very nice. Increasing Generator uptime is also very nice.
ftbquests.automation_age.hv_assembler.de: §6HV§r Assembler, used for §6HV§r Energy Hatches and Upgrade Kits, along with SMDs for cheaper circuit crafting.
ftbquests.automation_age.lpic_chip.descr: This Chip is used to make §6HV§r Energy Hatches and Transformers.
ftbquests.automation_age.lpic_chip.title: LPIC Chips
ftbquests.automation_age.smds.descriptio: The first upgrade to every circuit component. Is more resource efficient and gives more per craft.
ftbquests.automation_age.smds.title: SMDs
Will increase the power of anything thermal by 24x.
ftbquests.automation_age.hv_converters.d: Lets you turn your RF into §6HV§r power.
A crafting ingredient for items that need energy, and a battery that stores §6HV§r energy.
ftbquests.automation_age.hv_autoclave.de:
Grow your crystals even faster.

Can be upgraded into a Large Autoclave soon.
ftbquests.automation_age.nanomuscle_armo: Armor with build in night vision and step assist.
ftbquests.automation_age.cleanroom.descr: The Cleanroom is a structure that filters inside itself, allowing for a dust free environment to achieve more precise crafting.
ftbquests.automation_age.hv_circuit_asse: §5EV§r Circuits give you access to the §6HV§r Circuit Assembler. I recommend putting this in your Cleanroom to save time.
ftbquests.automation_age.micro_processor: The end of the circuit upgrade chain will bring you into §9IV§r, bet you didn't expect that.
ftbquests.automation_age.ev_64a_energy_c:
Allows you to turn RF into §5EV§r power.

Oh ya and 64A converters exist from now on.
ftbquests.automation_age.enderium_wire.d: §5EV§r superconductor, can hold 32 amps in a 1x cable.
Nichrome is one of the first alloys requiring a Vacuum Freezer to cool down.
ftbquests.automation_age.lumium_wire.des: §6HV§r superconductor, can hold 16 amps on the 1x cable.
ftbquests.automation_age.nichrome_coil.d:
3rd tier of coils for your EBF to allow you to increase the heat even more. Will start making hot ingots more often.

It also gives you your first heat based Overclocks for Aluminium and Stainless Steel notably.
Will increase the power of anything thermal by 48x. This is the final Upgrade Kit you can make for them.
ftbquests.automation_age.ev_assembler.de: You should understand what this does already right?
This cools down your Hot Ingots better and faster then the Chemical Bath could ever hope to achieve.
ftbquests.automation_age.multiblock_upgr: Used to turn §6HV§r machines into their §6Perfect Overclock§r multiblock variants
ftbquests.automation_age.distillation_to:
A very tall multiblock that allows you to distill one fluid into multiple others without having to choose like with the distillery.

Single block Distilleries can still be used but won't give you all products and can't be overclocked.
ftbquests.automation_age.oil.description: More Information in the Resource Production Tab
ftbquests.automation_age.oil.title: Oil
ftbquests.automation_age.drilling_rig.de:
Allows you to pump oil from the void. I don't know how that works out, but it does.

Better Drills do not drain chunks as much and work much faster.
ftbquests.automation_age.prospector.desc:
Allows you to scan your surrounding chunks for fluids.

Spoilers, it's going to be oil.
ftbquests.automation_age.desulfurize.des: Mix Oil distillation byproducts with some hydrogen to clean them, allowing you to distill them further.
ftbquests.automation_age.cracker.descrip:
Choose an oil byproduct and get it cracked to allow even further processing.

Taking some time to figure out which cracking method for what product is the best for you is recommended.

Note: Chemical Reactors can be used for cracking but are less efficient.
ftbquests.automation_age.cracker.title: Oil Cracking
ftbquests.automation_age.distilling.desc: I hope you like having many distillation towers.
ftbquests.automation_age.styrene_butadie:
Another material that can be used to coat cables, it's the most efficient resource wise.

Should now be easily craftable with oil distillation fully set up.
ftbquests.automation_age.ev_energy_input: Allows you to run your multiblocks off of pure §5EV§r power, or even overclock to §9IV§r.
4th tier of Coils for all your smelting needs.

This needs Ruthenium, which you get from the Platline, check it out in the "Processing Lines" chapter.
Almost as hot as an RTX
ftbquests.automation_age.tungsten_steel_:
This is the §9IV§r material.

You are going to need a lot of this, just like every other main voltage material.
ftbquests.automation_age.liquid_airs.des: Distilling each air type will give you access to a variety of different chemicals, all of which will be useful in one way or another.
ftbquests.automation_age.cupric_chloride:
The best liquid for etching Circuit Boards.

We recommend switching out your §oAE2§r patterns to use this.
ftbquests.automation_age.mpic_chip.descr: This Chip is used for making §5EV§r tier Energy Hatches and Transformers.
ftbquests.automation_age.mpic_chip.title: MPIC Chips
ftbquests.automation_age.phosphorus_wafe: You can use this in a Laser Engraver to make new chips, or make the old ones more efficiently.
ftbquests.automation_age.ev_energy_input:
This hatch can do something called Speed Overclocking.

A Speed Overclock is a special kind of Overclocking, that makes your machine run recipes at the next tier of voltage.

However, unlike normal Overclock, it will not make the machine be able to do recipes at that higher tier.

As an example, a 4A §5EV§r Hatch will let a machine run at §9IV§r speed, but only do §5EV§r or lower recipes.
A 16A §5EV§r Energy Hatch will let a machine run at §dLuV§r speed, but only do §5EV§r or lower recipes.
ftbquests.automation_age.phosphorus_boul: Second tier of Boule. Can be used to make new types of chips as well as make older types more efficiently.
ftbquests.automation_age.phosphorus_dust: Acquired from Apatite or Monazite processing.
ftbquests.automation_age.soc.subtitle: Cheaper LV and MV Circuits
ftbquests.automation_age.soc.title: SoC Chips
ftbquests.automation_age.mv_circuit_asse: A better tier of circuit assembler allowing you to make circuits faster and the §eMicrochip§r line which you will use for a while.
ftbquests.automation_age.large_chemical_: Now you have §8PTFE§r, you can make one of the most useful multiblocks, the Large Chemical Reactor (LCR for short). You will have so many of these by the end of the pack.
ftbquests.automation_age.ev_circuit_asse: Better Circuits, Faster Circuits, Cheaper Circuits, this is a big one.
The final §6HV§r circuit. Like previous circuits, this has a cheaper recipe once you gain access to a new chip.
ftbquests.automation_age.multi_smelter.d: A multiblock that has two uses, either smelting normal items or creating alloys at an extreme rate.
ftbquests.automation_age.epoxy_circuit_b: The spoils from the massive epoxy processing line.
ftbquests.automation_age.nano_cpu_chip.d: A different way to make chips, by covering them in chemicals.
ftbquests.automation_age.nor_memory_chip: These chips will be needed in almost every other circuit from now on, might want to keep a lot of these in stock.
ftbquests.automation_age.iv_energy_input: Lets you power your multiblocks with §9IV§r or overclock to §dLuv§r.
ftbquests.automation_age.iv_assembler.de: §9IV§r Assembly Machine, used to make higher tier Coils and Energy Hatches. Can be upgraded into the Assembly Machine multiblock's controller.
ftbquests.automation_age.shellite_wire.d: Lets you turn your RF into §9IV§r power.
ftbquests.automation_age.micro_processor: This is the final version of the §bMV§r circuit, however just like the §7LV§r circuit, there is a cheaper recipe that unlocks later on.
ftbquests.automation_age.hpic_chip.descr: This Chip is used in both §9IV§r and §dLuV§r Energy Hatches and Transformers as well as Assembly Line Casings.
ftbquests.automation_age.hpic_chip.title: HPIC Chips
ftbquests.automation_age.advanced_smds.d: The second upgrade to all the Circuit Components. Very resource efficient and is needed for high tier Circuits.
ftbquests.automation_age.hssg_coil.descr:
The 5th tier of Coils.

These will give you the heat to make HSS-E and HSS-S ingots. That's not going to get confusing at all.
ftbquests.automation_age.hssg_ingot.desc: The first High Speed Steel available.
ftbquests.automation_age.hsss_ingot.desc: A denser and harder form of HSS.
ftbquests.automation_age.alloy_blast_sme:
This multiblock allows you to create even more complex alloys, but will give outputs in a molten form.

The ABS performs both mixing and smelting, producing multiple ingot units (144 mB each) while requiring only 75%% of the time compared to its EBF counterpart.

You will need to cool the Molten Liquids in a Vacuum Freezer.
ftbquests.automation_age.microchip_proce: This is the final version of the §7LV§r circuit, however with a bit more progression you will gain access to an even cheaper recipe for it.
ftbquests.automation_age.nuclear_reactor:
The Nuclear Reactor can be used to transform §8Thorium§r into §aUranium§r and §2Uraniums§r into §cPlutoniums§r. Additionally it produces quite a lot of power.

Make sure that your dynamo hatches are big enough.

Oh, and maybe look into paralleling this thing when you can, you could say it causes quite the reaction.
ftbquests.automation_age.radon.descripti:
A gas that will be used a lot for Quantum Eyes and Stars.

We highly recommend setting Radon Loop up when you can, even if you have Ender Air distillation.
ftbquests.automation_age.power_chapter.d:
More power storage options and batteries are shown.

More Power Storage Here
ftbquests.automation_age.laminated_glass: A type of reinforced Glass, with better sealing capacities.
ftbquests.automation_age.title: Automation Age
ftbquests.draconic_age.the_nether.descri:
Venture through the Ancient Stargate to discover the burning Nether.

Keep in mind that the Nether is a hostile environment, that might require some protective armor.
ftbquests.draconic_age.the_nether.title: The Burning Hells Await
ftbquests.draconic_age.end_armor.descrip: Scans indicate that the End is an even more inhospitable dimension due to entropic forces. This armor will help mitigate the effects. The End inhabitants might be hiding a §ltalisman§r capable of nullifying the effects of the abyss...
ftbquests.draconic_age.the_end.descripti:
Venture through the Ancient Stargate to discover the hollow End.

Keep in mind that the End is an extremely dangerous environment, that will require some strong armor.
ftbquests.draconic_age.the_end.title: The Draconic Abyss awaits
ftbquests.draconic_age.dragon_kill.descr: Vanquish the Ender Dragon, and free the End of the final dragon.
ftbquests.draconic_age.dragon_kill.title: The Last Dragon Falls
ftbquests.draconic_age.abyssal_harvester: The abyss of the End holds pure levels of Entropy. Using this machine, you can harvest different Entropy states of Voidic Excression, and channel those towards technological advancement.
ftbquests.draconic_age.dragon_cells.desc:
Draconic cells, carrying the powerful genes of the dragon race.

Channel their power into computing for new circuit technology or enhancing materials.
ftbquests.draconic_age.draconic_processi: A processing unit combining Wetware technology with Draconic Brain Matter Cells to achieve breakthroughs in computing.
ftbquests.draconic_age.husk_of_the_flame: A mystical artifact. To find, locate shrines inside the nether.
ftbquests.draconic_age.voidic_metals.des: Alloys that harness the power of the End, controlling the flow of energy.
ftbquests.draconic_age.draco_infusion.de:
A mystical infusion array that allows you to harness the powers of the end.

This multiblock requires the inputs to be placed in the correct order.

On the structure, the inputs are mapped according to the following diagram:

Top View:

§d -1-2-
§d 3-0-4
§d -5-6-
§d --@--

§lItem Inputs§r: 0-6 as per the Recipe Image

§lFluid Input§r: Top Center of the Orb §7[Directly Above Item Input 0]

@ : Controller
ftbquests.draconic_age.uiv_alloys.descri: These are extremely charged abyssal alloys, that pave the way to §2UIV§r
ftbquests.draconic_age.uiv_alloys.title: UIV Alloys
ftbquests.draconic_age.abyssal_alloy_coi: The last tier of coils, brimming with Entropy, to fulfill all your smelting needs.
ftbquests.draconic_age.hellish_magmas.de: Deep in the crust of the nether lay great veins of Hellish Magmas, containing riches beyond ones wildest dreams.
ftbquests.draconic_age.mystical_metals.d: Rare and expensive metals produced by processing the Hellish Magmas.
ftbquests.draconic_age.hellstones.descri:
These stones are found in veins across the nether. Their mystical properties are needed to advance in casing technology.

§4Brimstone§r: is found near radioactive ore deposits

§3Cryostone§r: is found near conductive ore deposits
ftbquests.draconic_age.hellstones.title: Hellstones
ftbquests.draconic_age.draco_circuit_ass: A new type of circuit assembler, that can not only produce better circuits, but also produce large amounts of basic circuits.
ftbquests.draconic_age.uev_fusion_reacto: The fourth tier of fusion reactors, reaching over 1 Billion Kelvin.
ftbquests.draconic_age.cryostate_quantum: A new fridge, for cooling down your ingots at higher speeds than ever.
ftbquests.draconic_age.draco_boule.descr: A boule purified to immense capabilities allowing for even stronger of circuits
ftbquests.draconic_age.sterile_cleaning_: A Sterile Maintenance Hatch, that will allow Sterile recipes to be run outside of a cleanroom.
ftbquests.draconic_age.abyssal_containme: A machines capable of simulating the end in an uncorrupted and pure state
ftbquests.draconic_age.uiv_auxiliary_boo: An Auxiliary Fusion Ractor capable of running MK4 recipes and more
ftbquests.draconic_age.uipic_chip.descri: Core of technology for the long lost Draconic Empires
ftbquests.draconic_age.positioner.title: positioner
ftbquests.draconic_age.hellforge.descrip: A towering furnace, needing both fuel and power, to heat up materials to Mega-kelvins.
ftbquests.draconic_age.aurourium_ingot.d: A strong material needed for upgrading your infrastructure to §2UIV§r.
ftbquests.draconic_age.mega_abs.descript: A parallel Alloy Blast Smelter, just in case it wasn't fast enough already.
ftbquests.draconic_age.nyanium_ingot.des: A special material that holds mystical properties.
ftbquests.draconic_age.dragon_breath.des: Pick up some dragons breath during the fight.
ftbquests.draconic_age.maxwell.descripti:
Having witnessed the creation of Maxwell, you have been blessed by its enlightenment. You have reached the end of your journey for now, and as with the knowledge bestowed upon you, you hear its voice, telling you to move forward, and embrace an even larger challenge.

If you enjoyed StarT, and want more §msuffering§r enjoyment, don't fret. For your cravings we have developed StarT Hardmode.

To switch to HM, simply open up your instance folder, and run one of the packmode picker files.

We recommend you do this in a different instance to avoid accidentally breaking a world when joining with the wrong packmode on.

&7Hardmode is currently on development hiatus with expected return mid-late 2026

ftbquests.draconic_age.maxwell.subtitle: Cat
ftbquests.draconic_age.completion.descri:
Thank you for playing through this pack to its current state. A lot of time has been put in so that it was a unique and enjoyable experience. You are invited to come show off your accomplishment on our discord where we would love to hear what you thoughts about the pack.

The content past this point is still in development, and will be available in the next major release, §l§9Theta§r§r.

-§oStarT Dev Team§r

&7cya in 2026
ftbquests.draconic_age.completion.subtit: Congratulations, for now this is the end of the content, though, if you join the discord you can often see what comes next.
ftbquests.draconic_age.completion.title: You have completed the §5§lEta§r Version of §6Star Technology§r
ftbquests.draconic_age.vasilisa.descript: A legendary feline, as energized as the flames from inferno.
ftbquests.draconic_age.vasilisa.subtitle: Cat
ftbquests.draconic_age.uev_alloys.descri: A new set of Alloys, forged from the flames of hell, ready for some industrial purposes.
ftbquests.draconic_age.uev_alloys.title: UEV Alloys
ftbquests.draconic_age.valenok.descripti: A legendary feline, as eternal as the endless abyss.
ftbquests.draconic_age.valenok.subtitle: Cat
ftbquests.draconic_age.mars.description: A legendary feline, combining the heat and cold from two dimensions.
ftbquests.draconic_age.mars.subtitle: Cat
ftbquests.draconic_age.end_again.descrip: Need some more breath? Respawn the dragon.
ftbquests.draconic_age.end_again.title: Dragon Fight Repeats
ftbquests.draconic_age.end_city.descript: Find an end city, and loot it.
ftbquests.draconic_age.end_city.title: Cities of The Abyss
ftbquests.draconic_age.dragon_breath_loo: Now that you have Draconic Cells, you can start looping dragon's breath.
ftbquests.draconic_age.nether_talisman.d:
You have been granted protection in this place allowing you to forgo armor needs.

Alternatively you can craft this after acquiring the appropriate materials.
ftbquests.draconic_age.end_talisman.desc:
You have been granted protection in this place allowing you to forgo armor needs.

Alternatively you can craft this after acquiring the appropriate means.
ftbquests.draconic_age.abyssal_processor: The tip of technology the Draconic Empires were capable of.... it knows what you did
ftbquests.draconic_age.coolants.descript: Your new freezer will need better coolants, that surpass Helium in efficiency.
ftbquests.draconic_age.coolants.title: Advanced Cooling Materials
ftbquests.draconic_age.draconic_enrichme: A medium of growth DNA for even more capable neuro-technology
ftbquests.draconic_age.draconic_circuit_: The start of your wildest dreams, a dragon based circuit board.
ftbquests.draconic_age.abyssal_circuit_b: This is what Draconic Circuits were meant to be
ftbquests.draconic_age.draco_abyssal_ing: Corrupted by the abyss it is the closest thing known to primordial wyrms
ftbquests.draconic_age.seaborgium_pallad: The &aUEV&r superconductor used in your machines and components.
ftbquests.draconic_age.magmada_alloy_coi: A new tier of coils, harnessing the heat of the Nether in order to liquify even the strongest of materials.
ftbquests.draconic_age.super_heavy_eleme: Somehow, some way, they just refuse to decay.
ftbquests.draconic_age.rhenium_super_com: The &2UIV&r superconductor used in your machines and components.
ftbquests.draconic_age.maxwellium.descri: Do do do do do do, dodododo do, odododododo do, dooo, dooo, dooo, dooo, dododododo do, ododododo do, dododododododdoooooddo da
ftbquests.draconic_age.bastion.descripti: Find the Blackened Castles and Loot Them.
ftbquests.draconic_age.bastion.title: Fiery Castles
ftbquests.draconic_age.draconic_qmds.des: A new set of SMDs infused with the ancient essence of the ender dragons.
ftbquests.draconic_age.multithreaded_com:
Stabilization? Threads? Stocking? Research? It is faster than all of your assembly lines.

This....

This is the pinnacle of component creation
ftbquests.draconic_age.atomic_synthesis_:
You like the Chemical Plant?

Well this is its older sibling
ftbquests.draconic_age.component_part_hu: A component part assembly with all the trinkets
ftbquests.draconic_age.poomba.descriptio: A legendary feline, combining the heat and cold from two dimensions. But differently?
ftbquests.draconic_age.poomba.component_: We're going to need some powerful data containers
ftbquests.draconic_age.abyssal_printed_c: Engraved with only the toughest of conductors available
I said not to worry about it.



&d&mBingus
ftbquests.draconic_age.threading_control: The Stats assigner for ALL of your threaded multiblock needs
ftbquests.draconic_age.hell_forge_cataly: By using special catalysts you can achieve a &a33%%&r reduction in recipe time. The same type of bonus you would get with Gas Boosting in an &7EBF&r or &7ABS&r.
ftbquests.draconic_age.threading_multibl:
Machines at the pinnacle of technology....

They are slightly powerful
ftbquests.draconic_age.title: Draconic Empires
ftbquests.early_game.oak_log.description: The start of any skyblock pack. Who wood have guessed.
ftbquests.early_game.oak_log.title: Tree Chopping
ftbquests.early_game.mud_sieving.descrip: It is recommended to make more dirt, before using up your entire starter island on this useful resource.
ftbquests.early_game.mud_sieving.title: Mud Sieving
ftbquests.early_game.gravel_sieving.desc: The spoils of war when a string mesh is involved!
ftbquests.early_game.basic_electronic_ci: With all the parts combined, you finally get your hands on your first §7LV§r circuit! It might be a good idea to make a bunch of these beforehand, to aid in the push for §7LV§r machines.
ftbquests.early_game.soul_infused_wire.d:
Your first superconductor!

Superconductors are lossless, meaning they won't lose power the farther they go. Always use them, when possible.
ftbquests.early_game.andesite_alloy.desc: Create's number one alloy, now with a better crafting ratio!
ftbquests.early_game.mechanical_press.de: Tired of needing two ingots per plate? The Mechanical Press lets you make plates for half the price early on!
ftbquests.early_game.cured_rubber.descri:
Extracting Latex from §lJungle Trees§r will be one of your first sources of rubber, after a bit of processing.

There are 2 ways to do this, either by placing §nArboreal Extractors§r around a Jungle Tree or by building the §nLatex Plantation§r multiblock.

By combining Rubber and Sulfur you can get cured rubber.

- This can be done by using a heated Create mixer.
- This can be done by using a Steam Alloy Smelter.
- This can be done by using a Cooking Pot with a campfire under it.

§nNote§r: For the Latex Plantation you can use a wooden tap in the controller block, to use the better tap methods with a fuel and circuit you'll need a §8ULV§r Input Bus at a minimum. An Output Hatch can be placed on the back to automate further but isn't needed.
ftbquests.early_game.cured_rubber.title: Latex Extraction
ftbquests.early_game.gregtech_tools.desc: Every greg master needs their toolbelt fully stocked to get their first machines ready. We recommend starting with Iron or Wrought Iron tools, or taking a look at the shop!
ftbquests.early_game.wrought_iron.descri: Wrought Iron is made by sizzling iron on a campfire or stove.
ftbquests.early_game.wrought_iron.title: Frying Iron
ftbquests.early_game.lv_converters.descr: Converters are essential for power transfer in this pack, as they are used to convert between EU and FE/RF. EU conversion is disabled for StarT, so you will need one of these whenever energy conversion is necessary. Keep in mind that §a4 FE/RF§r is equal to §61 EU§r.
ftbquests.early_game.lv_converters.title: The Great Industrial Revolution
ftbquests.early_game.create_mixer.descri: By heating a mixer, you can start to make your first alloys.
ftbquests.early_game.create_mixer.title: Alloy Mixing
ftbquests.early_game.rubber.description: Rubber is an important material, used for coating wires.
ftbquests.early_game.rubber.title: Cable Insulation
ftbquests.early_game.ulv_barrel.descript:
Barrel transformations from Ex Nihilo have been disabled, and replaced with this beautiful machine!

It can soak, compost, and transform.

Be sure to choose the correct "§n§o§7Active Machine Mode§r", in the tab on the left of the UI.
ftbquests.early_game.ulv_barrel.title: Barrel Transformations
ftbquests.early_game.primitive_blast_fur:
It's your very first multiblock!

This bad boy will make you steel, albeit slowly. It isn't possible to automate sadly, but there is a better version on the horizon.
ftbquests.early_game.steel.description: It is recommended to use Wrought Iron for your steel processing, as it cuts the recipe time down by a noticeable amount.
ftbquests.early_game.steel.title: Steel
ftbquests.early_game.red_alloy.descripti: The most valuable alloy you can make right now, due to how much you will need for circuits.
ftbquests.early_game.red_alloy.title: Red Alloy
ftbquests.early_game.slime_resin.descrip: Things are going to get sticky when using the Slitake Spores.
ftbquests.early_game.slime_resin.title: Slime and Resin
ftbquests.early_game.resin_circuit_board: Let's ignore the fact that this circuit board is just a plank of wood with some cables stuck to it with glue.
ftbquests.early_game.resistors.descripti: Every circuit needs some resistors to stop it from blowing up in your face.
ftbquests.early_game.resistors.title: Resistors
ftbquests.early_game.glass.description: Making glass isn't as simple as smelting sand now. First, you must grind down some Sand and Flint, mix it together into Glass Dust, and then give it a sizzle on a campfire.
ftbquests.early_game.glass.title: Glassworks
ftbquests.early_game.crooking.descriptio: Breaking leaves with a crook will drop Silkworms, which can be used on leaves to infest them. Sit back, watch the infestation spread, and reap the rewards with your crook.
ftbquests.early_game.crooking.title: Wormy Business
ftbquests.early_game.vacuum_tubes.descri: Let's put that steel to good use. You may want to hold off on making too many of these, at least before getting a lathe.
ftbquests.early_game.vacuum_tubes.title: Vacuum Tubes
ftbquests.early_game.soul_sand.descripti: By combining Witch Water and Sand together, you can make your first Soul Sand. You can either repeat this, or invest in a §3Soul Campfire§r to bulk haunt more Soul Sand and other materials.
ftbquests.early_game.soul_sand.title: Soul Sand
ftbquests.early_game.invar.description: If you think the amount of different alloys are bad right now, then just you wait.
ftbquests.early_game.invar.title: Invar
ftbquests.early_game.gold.description: Gold has a few uses for making Create components and machines, and is used for some alloys in §7LV§r
ftbquests.early_game.gold.title: Gold
ftbquests.early_game.primitive_ore_facto:
Now that you have some Brass, you can construct a new multiblock to process your ores further.

This will give you access to important resources, like gold and nickel.
ftbquests.early_game.aqueous_accumulator: Pop this next to two water sources and you will never be thirsty again.
ftbquests.early_game.bone_meal.descripti: Chuck your spare saplings into a Composter for some bonemeal. This will be necessary to obtain lava.
ftbquests.early_game.bone_meal.title: Making Bonemeal
ftbquests.early_game.lava.description: Lava gives you access to cobblestone, which will contain everything you might ever need in life. You could also use it as a fuel, no one here is judging you.
ftbquests.early_game.lava.title: Making Lava
ftbquests.early_game.coke_oven.descripti: A staple of any GregTech pack. Get some tasty creosote to coat your planks in.
ftbquests.early_game.coke_oven.title: Coke Oven
ftbquests.early_game.large_farm.descript:
Needing lots of crops quickly? Then this multiblock has your back!

You might get some good use out of this when making Bio Diesel.

You can optionally use buses and hatches for automation, otherwise you can interact directly with the controller.
ftbquests.early_game.large_farm.title: Large Farm
ftbquests.early_game.sieves_and_meshes.d: Sieving is the only way to obtain resources early on. They can be automated, with a little cleverness.
ftbquests.early_game.large_barrel.descri:
A larger barrel means faster recipes! Maybe this will help with that slime addiction...

You can optionally use buses and hatches for automation, otherwise you can interact directly with the controller.
ftbquests.early_game.large_barrel.title: Large Barrel
Automatic pebbles and lava? Making a few of these sounds like a good use of your time.

You can optionally use buses and hatches for automation, otherwise you can interact directly with the controller.
ftbquests.early_game.dirt_duping.descrip: By combining dirt and gravel into Coarse Dirt and sieving it, you can double your dirt, and you even have a chance to get some of the gravel back!
ftbquests.early_game.dirt_duping.title: Dirt Cheap
ftbquests.early_game.create.description: Create stresses me out, but without that nothing would move.
ftbquests.early_game.create.title: Stressed Out
ftbquests.early_game.steam_engine.descri:
Since Blazes are out of the question, a Basic Burner is needed to heat Basins.
Note that you can §6superheat§r Basic Burners with an Encased Fan at max §3RPM§r, though it will burn through fuel faster (32x).
ftbquests.early_game.steam_engine.title: Steam Powered
ftbquests.early_game.diesel_engine.descr:
Diesel Engines are a great way to generate large amounts of Stress Units for Create machines. Bio Diesel is one of the best fuel sources, but it requires some automating to keep a steady supply.

You can produce Ethanol using either the Basin Lid or the Casket. The Basin Lid is 1.5x faster, whilst the Casket is simpler to work with.
ftbquests.early_game.diesel_engine.title: Diesel Engines
ftbquests.early_game.fluid_cell.descript: Early fluid storage that can push and pull fluids. It accepts upgrades that can dramatically increase the storage capacity.
ftbquests.early_game.fluid_cell.title: Early Fluid Storage
ftbquests.early_game.bronze_brass.descri: Create gives you access to your first alloys, though at a poorer ratio than later methods. While good in the early game, you will want to upgrade once you hit §7LV§r.
ftbquests.early_game.bronze_brass.title: Bronze and Brass
ftbquests.early_game.stone_barrel.descri: By putting in a bucket of lava and pumping water in, the Stone Barrel is able to produce you as much cobble as your heart desires. Just be sure to select the correct "ghost circuit", which can be done in the bottom right of the machine's interface.
ftbquests.early_game.stone_barrel.title: Easy Cobblestone
ftbquests.early_game.witch_water.descrip:
Witch Water can be made in a Wooden Barrel with Mycelium Spores and Water.

Make sure that your Wooden Barrel is on "§n§o§7Barrel Transformation§r" mode. Refer to the Barrel Transformation quest for more information.
ftbquests.early_game.witch_water.title: Witch Water
ftbquests.early_game.oak_crucible.descri: Crucibles are handy devices that turn saplings into water, only to be discarded moments later. Using a bucket made of logs, you can magically scoop up this vital liquid.
ftbquests.early_game.oak_crucible.title: Obtaining Water
ftbquests.early_game.nickel.description: Nickel is a base material used in quite a few alloys. Getting a good amount early on will definitely be beneficial.
ftbquests.early_game.nickel.title: Nickel
ftbquests.early_game.crushing_wheels.des: Using Crushing Wheels, you can automate gravel and sand. Crushing wheels have a set amount of time they need to process their items (based on their RPM), but can process up to a stack of items at a time. Smart Chutes are an easy way to pump a stack of items in at a time.
ftbquests.early_game.start.description:
The Questbook takes you through the entire modpack, step by step. Here are a few things you should know:

§5-§r Mechanics: A small chapter explaining some GregTech mechanics
§5-§r Processing Lines: These chapters explain complicated processing lines
§5-§r Line of Progression: This chapter shows you all multiblocks and tiered items such as Coils'
'§5-§r Resource Production: This chapter shows you how to get MOST of the raw resources you will need
§5-§r Quality of Life: This chapter unveils some helpful mods and features that exist to make the pack more enjoyable

If a Quest doesn't load/register try rejoining.
ftbquests.early_game.start.title: Ready, Set, Go
ftbquests.early_game.dust_mixing.descrip: An alternative to the mixer from create.
ftbquests.early_game.dust_mixing.title: Mixing Dusts
ftbquests.early_game.solid_blast_furnace: A much needed upgrade to steel production. It's faster, and can be automated!
ftbquests.early_game.tempered_glass.desc:
While Tempered Glass is typically made in an Arc Furnace, it can be made in a Stone Barrel with Lava and Glass.

It will be needed to make the Rock Filtrator which is what gates the Arc Furnace.
ftbquests.early_game.firebrick.descripti: The building-block of any primitive machine.
ftbquests.early_game.firebrick.title: Firebrick
ftbquests.early_game.steam_ore_factory.d:
A Primitive Ore Factory upgraded for speed and power.

Not only does it use steam to power over pesky coals but it can perform recipes in parallel using steam.
ftbquests.early_game.pebbling.descriptio: By sneaking and right-clicking Grass (the dirt one), you can get pebbles for basic stone types.
ftbquests.early_game.pebbling.title: Touching Grass
ftbquests.early_game.steam_alloy_smelter:
While not required for progression, you'll no longer have to mix and §nTHEN§r smelt. Now it'll be in a single step.

If you are using steam machines, make sure to check EMI/JEI to see what other you could make use of. They can be quite handy if you don't have §7LV§r machines yet.
ftbquests.early_game.steam.description:
There are many machines which can use steam to do your desired task even before you have voltage.

Steam can be produced by Boilers either §7Low Pressure§r or §8High Pressure§r.
Alternatively you can use thermal boilers which can be made by right clicking a dynamo with a steam pipe.
ftbquests.early_game.steam.title: Steam Power
ftbquests.early_game.clay.description:
The literal building bricks to your designs.

Dust to Clay Blocks in a Barrel is a quick and easy solution to all of you masonry pursuits.
ftbquests.early_game.clay.title: Clay
ftbquests.early_game.large_steam_machine: Larger versions of their single block counter-parts able to make use of steam parallels.
ftbquests.early_game.steam_boilers.descr:
Early on you can produce steam using solid fuels like charcoal, liquid fuels like creosote, or §e§lTHE SUN§r §o(only during the day)§r. High Pressure burns faster for higher Steam/tick. Keep in mind they explode without water

High Pressure and Low Pressure Steam Machines can run most §8ULV§r and §7LV§r recipes at the cost of steam instead of power making them a nice addition to your arsenal.
ftbquests.early_game.steam_boilers.title: Steam Boilers
A §o§lMUCH§r better composter that allows you to do thing and bulk with easier automation.
ftbquests.early_game.coke_brick.descript: The building-block of your first wood oven.
ftbquests.early_game.coke_brick.title: Coke Brick
ftbquests.early_game.blackstone.descript: The materials you can acquire from Blackstone are needed to progress. It might be a good idea to automate this.
ftbquests.early_game.blackstone.title: Blackstone Sieving
ftbquests.early_game.kiln.description: A campfire on steroids for you early §nGlass§r and §nWrought Iron§r needs.
ftbquests.early_game.steam_kiln.descript: A Kiln but now with the power for even easier automation and in mass.
ftbquests.early_game.reach_upgrades.desc:
Ever feel like you should be able to build more with effortless building, well consume these to increase your reach.

§4Warning§r: Upgrade can be lost on death or relog in some instances so having some in a chest isn't a horrible idea.
ftbquests.early_game.casket.description:
The Casket is a machine that allows for easy Ethanol production.

Alongside that, it can also produce various brews, that gives beneficial effects when consumed.
ftbquests.early_game.vintage_rubber.desc: A slightly more complicated way of making rubber, that does not depend on latex.
ftbquests.early_game.vintage.description: Machines from vintage open up many interesting opportunities for more efficient material processing, alongside primitive ore processing.
ftbquests.early_game.vintage.title: Create: Vintage
ftbquests.early_game.peaceful.descriptio: This pack is designed to be played in §nPeaceful§r, hope you enjoy.
ftbquests.early_game.peaceful.title: No Mobs
ftbquests.early_game.hammers.title: Hammer Time
ftbquests.early_game.title: Early Game
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.quarktec:
QuarkTech armor is really nice. You can run and fly faster, toggle night vision and eat automatically.

You can also now hold Hot Ingots without dying.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.advanced: This one has a built-in Jetpack.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.iv_paral: Paralleling allows you to do more batches of a recipe at once.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.power_su:
The Power Substation is the endgame power storage. You might not need it yet in LuV, but later on you §lwill§r need this.

The structure itself does not store power, the capacitor blocks placed inside the station are what gives it storage capability.

Because of this, you can keep upgrading the substation as you progress through the pack, up until UHV.

When you reach UHV, you can craft the Ultimate Capacitor, which can store a *small* amount of power.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.assembly:
This is what you will use to make more advanced components and machines.

Inputs must be placed in THAT order and only in §8ULV§r input buses.

If something has multiple unstackables, a forming press with a rename is a good way to differentiate the item in inputs.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.luv_fusi:
Smash elements to get more powerful materials

Fusion Glass isn't a horrible idea

&4To copy \& paste a fusion reactor, first turn it off, otherwise you will brick your world!
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.iv_circu:
This is the final Circuit Assembler you'll make.

It can later be upgraded into a Large Circuit Assembling Facility, which accepts only a single Energy Hatch. This allows access to Circuit Assemblers of a higher voltage tier before getting the next tier of Circuits.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.64a_ev_s: §5EV§r Input and Output for the Substation.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.ruridit_: An alloy made out of precious metals.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.luv_ener: Now that you have the big Circuit Assembler, you can use this to instantly get access to §dLuV§r Circuit Assembler recipes.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.luv_sens: Get used to making all your components in an Assembly Line, because it will not change.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.data_ban: Allows you to store research data in mass and share it among multiple Assembly Lines or other Data Banks.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.high_per:
This multiblock provides computation to the research station. By playing around with components, you can generate enough computation to research things.

48§3CWU§r is the maximum sustainable early on with no bridging component.

36§3CWU§r is the maximum sustainable with a bridging component.

48§3CWU§r is the maximum sustainable with Abydos technology and a bridging component.

Bridging is further explained in the quest to the right.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.research: Scanner are not powerful enough to research high tier technologies. This multiblock can research almost anything!
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.luv_scan: Used for the final Data Stick scans, and can be upgraded into a Research Station.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.europium: Your first fusion product. Passiving this isn't a bad idea, as it will be the only thing you will really use your MK I Fusion Reactor for.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.crystal_: A SoC that makes crystal circuits cheaper.
A crystal processor, using crystals to transmit data with light rays.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.engraved: A more refined Crystal Chip, ready to be used for computing.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.raw_crys: A raw crystal etched in Europium to be used as a base for crystalline circuits.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.exquisit:
You should have some of this from your ore proc.

§oYou did passive your ore proc... right?§r
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.raw_crys: This can be used for looping your crystal chips, so you don't need a ton of emeralds.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.multilay: A stronger fiber-based circuit board, made by layering multiple normal ones over each other.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.wetware_: The first step into making computers think.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.neuro_pr: .... Is it just me or did it just look back?
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.zpm_fusi:
The second tier of Fusion Reactors.
Each tier of Fusion Reactors overclocks recipes below it and has higher heat capacity to allow for more fusion recipes to be run.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.uranium_: A precious metal made with 3 types of expensive resources. Used for §cZPM§r Field Generators and the second tier of Fusion Reactors.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.naquadah:
The 6th tier of Coils

These will get replaced quite quickly by Trinium.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.trinium_:
The 7th tier of Coils

It is worth getting all your EBF's to it, as the heat will save quite some energy.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.zpm_para: Even more parallels on your machine. If it hasn't happened yet, these will now definitely outpace your perfect overclock cubes.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.chemical: This beautiful machine allows you to compress entire processing lines into one machine.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.indium_t: Used for active transformers and in some other crafting recipes such as wire superconductor.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.uhpic_ch: This Chip is gonna be used for Gate Machines, Fusion Reactors and Energy Hatches.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.tritaniu: Tritanium is a material you are gonna need a ton of. If you have the Fusion Reactors, consider setting some on passive if you have the time.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.americiu: This is a material used for §3UV§r components and machines of §4UHV§r tier and beyond.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.cleaning: This Maintenance Hatch tricks your machines into believing they are in normal Cleanrooms, allowing you to run cleanroom recipes outside of one.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.naquadah: Time for some fancy new Chips.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.tritaniu: This is gonna be the final tier of Coils until you can reach Abydos. Swapping out all of your older Coils is recommended, because you will need the speed.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.naquadah: A new Boule, that unlocks new chips, and makes the older ones even cheaper.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.enriched: This material is used for some of the most important §4UHV§r machines.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.duranium: A fusion material made with MK I Fusion Reactors. It had basically no use up until now, but that is about to change.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.steriliz: These can replace your old Cleanroom Filters, and turn it into a Sterile Cleanroom. Do keep in mind that normal Cleanroom recipes do not work inside a Sterile Cleanroom
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.network_:
Unfortunately, you can connect only one HPCA to the research station. However, this multiblock can route the computation from several HPCAs into the research station!

HPCAs will need bridging components to be able to connect and transmit CWU through these.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.dimensio: A machine capable of tearing space-time using the power of Nether Stars, allowing you to harvest Naquadah from it.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.supercon: Used in fusion reactors to heat up atoms allowing them to fuse together.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.parallel: Finally, you can upgrade your resource generation with Parallel Hatches.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.dragonst: §cZPM§r superconductor, can hold 96 amps in a 1x cable.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.prismali:
§3UV§r superconductor, can hold 48 amps in a 1x cable.

Prismalium is not the only §3UV§r superconductor. There is also Melodium, which is shown in the next quest chapter.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.reinforc: Solidify your Epoxy in a more durable manner.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.data_mod: A stronger §nData Orb§r capable of knowing the most complex ordeals in this realm.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.redstone:
A way to monitor your multiblocks with §credstone§r outputs allowing for complex systems.

&7Currently this isn't needed till UEV
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.data_orb:
Used to store patterns for the Assembly Line.

Used Here
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.trinaqua: You made a Trinium Coil ABS right?
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.mega_vac: A parallel freezer. Great for when you have a lot of EBF's. Also matches up great with the RHF you will get later.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.super_ab:
A Boosted ABS.....

"Woo, imabouttomakeanameformyselfhere"

Oh... only 1 energy hatch, oh well its still cracked.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.super_va: A boosted VF, well I guess that's nice.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.naquadah: By processing down Naquadah through a series of reaction you can produce some fancy material.
ftbquests.futuristic_mechanisms.title: Futuristic Mechanisms
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.bender.d: Gives you plates at a 1:1 ratio.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.macerato: This can crush down all the things you'll need, keep in mind you'll need one at §6HV§r to get the byproducts.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.forge_ha: This can be used for automating gravel, sand and dust.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.conveyor: Can move items in and out of a machine, without needing extra blocks.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.assemble: The assembler is an advanced crafting machine, that can make a ton of items for cheaper.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.energy_i: With Energy Hatches you can now power massive machines to do your bidding.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.cutter.d: Can cut blocks into plates, and rods into bolts at a 1:4 ratio. This also unlocks Diamond GT Tools, which have a lot more durability.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.cobalt_b:
Your first Cutting Saw, made out of Cobalt Brass.

Cutting Saws will always use alloys that require some work, but are definitely worth the investment.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.cobalt_d: Cobalt Dust can acquired through either Cobaltite Sludge, the Electric Ore Factory, or simply washing Copper Ore.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.wiremill: 1 ingot into 2 wires, a better bargain can't be made.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.centrifu: Using the force of spinny things, this machine separates liquids, gases and items.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.electric: Can move fluids in and out of a machine without needing extra blocks.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.gas_coll: Collects Air at circuit 1, which can be centrifuged for Nitrogen and Oxygen. If you need a lot of Oxygen, it is recommended to use a different way, check the Processing Lines chapter for reference.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.fluid_so: This can be used for cheaper gears, and making hardened glass.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.extracto: Turns item into their liquid forms.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.electrol: Useful for separating items into their base forms.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.graphite: You'll need to process some diamond ore for this.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.arc_furn: Operates using Oxygen, and can recycle machines into ingots.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.lv_upgra:
Used to upgrade all Thermal machine stats by 6x.

Very useful to use on:
- Dynamos
- Energy Cells
- Fluid Cells
- Aqueous Accumulators
- Igneous Extruders
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.super_ch: Super Chests grant massive storage capacity, offering some more utility than just drawers.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.electric:
The Electric Blast Furnace (EBF for short) is a better furnace, which you will need for most of your ingots going forward. If you are curious about how to use the EBF for §bMV§r recipes
Click Here
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.aluminiu:
This is your §bMV§r material, will be needed in vast quantities.

A good first source of Aluminium is Sapphire(s) or Sodalite.

Once you are in §bMV§r, you can set up Clay Electrolysis for easier Aluminium.
A good source of Arsenic.

§oUse the Void Extractor §nor§r§o Rock Filtrator to obtain this.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.gallium_: A binding catalyst for making Boules.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.sphaleri: Processing Sphalerite is going to be the best source of Gallium for a long time.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.diode.de: Another type of component for circuits used in §bMV§r and above.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.boules.d: Boules can be cut into Wafers, which will be core ingredients for most of your Circuits and Energy Hatches from now on.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.wafers.d: Every boule needs to be cut down into wafers for further processing.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.polarize: Gives metals magnetic charge. Also functions as an energizer.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.vanadium: The material for your next Cutting Blade.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.mv_cutte: The §bMV§r Cutter can cut Wafers from Silicon Boules, which are used for better circuit recipes.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.mv_energ: This converter makes §bMV§r power, instead of §7LV§r.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.mv_laser: Wafers are kinda useless on their own. You can inscribe them with the Laser Engraver and a colored lens, making them more useful.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.phenolic: Made with either Sodium Persulfate or Iron III Chloride. Both are explained in the Processing Lines chapter.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.circuit_: Makes all your Circuits going forward, and makes the older ones for a lower price.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.pyrolyse:
Used primarily for making Charcoal and Coal Coke.

Can replace your Coke Oven as a source of Creosote.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.ilc_chip: This chip will be used to make better §7LV§r circuits, which can be upgraded to even higher tiers.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.ulpic_ch: This Chip is used for creating an Energy Hatch that gives §bMV§r power to multiblocks as well as transforming power to §bMV§r.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.mv_energ: These can be used to overclock your EBF again, this time to §6HV§r.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.mv_assem: You should be starting to get the hang of it. A higher tier of machine, allowing for more recipes, and doing the previous ones faster.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.super_ta:
Super Tanks store a large amount of liquids.
However, they do need Polyethylene to be made. Check the Processing lines chapter for more information.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.mv_upgra: 2x as efficient as the LV one.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.rare_ear: For now the most useful material out of these is Neodymium, being used for higher tier Motors and Magnets.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.certus_q: Can be grown in the Autoclave from dust, or gotten by putting Purified Certus Quartz Ore through a Sifter.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.electric: A faster and more advanced version of the Primitive Ore Factory, capable of handling higher tier ores.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.hot_kant:
Normally you would cool it down in a Vacuum Freezer, but that is still a little ways off.

Until then you can use the Chemical Bath to cool it down into the normal ingot.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.stainles: This is your §6HV§r material, will be needed in vast quantities.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.kanthal_:
The next material for Coils.

It is not easy to get, but most definitely worth it.
Kanthal Coils are the second tier of coils.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.hot_sili: Now you've cooled your first silicon ingots, you can finally make use of all the silicon that's lying about your base.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.inscribe: Use these to press plates into printed circuits.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.printed_: You are gonna need a lot of these, though they get more efficient the better wafers you have.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.rock_fil:
The machine allowing you to gather all the Geodes and Gems you could ever need.

You'll probably want two §7LV§r Output Buses to have enough room for the Geodes.

Note: This machine only supports a single Energy Hatch.

Uses Found Here:
Geodes
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.void_ext:
Gather ore from mining and collecting the dust around you.

Make sure to save the liquids for later as you can get more and rarer materials.

Note: This machine can only take a single Energy Hatch. Additionally, make sure you have enough output space: 2 §7LV§r Output Buses, and 2 §7LV§r Output Hatches will do the trick.

Use Found Here:
Void Extraction
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.rare_ear: Contains various precious resources that you will need later on.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.vanadium: The source for Vanadium, a metal primarily used in alloys.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.etching_:
Get Iron (III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate to etch your circuits.

One of the following quest needs to be completed:

Sodium Persulfate

Iron (III) Chloride
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.resource: Go Check Out other Questbook Pages
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.annealed: Oxidised copper is used for a number of recipes in wire and bolt form. Copper in an Arc Furnace is the best way.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.transist: Another type of component for circuits used in §6HV§r and above.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.ram_chip: Stronger Chips used for Stronger Circuits all the way till §4UHV§r.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.power_ch:
Go look at the "Power" chapter of the questbook to see what other options exist for power.

This will show you power at each tier
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.mixer.de: Used mostly for mixing dusts into more complicated substances
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.mechanic:
That pesky sieving has now evolved to consume power and yield you much stronger results.

Note: Can only have 1 Energy Hatch

[No, Mesh Enchants do §4NOT§r impact performance]
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.cupronic:
The first of many coils. Each tier of coil has better stats that impact multiple machines. Make sure to take a look at the tooltips.

All recipes in the EBF have both a minimum coil and energy tier requirement. If these conditions are not met, the EBF won't operate.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.tin_allo: Earliest way to make this is by using an extractor.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.mv_proce: These §bMV§r machines will allow you to process more things. Most notably you can start to break down those fluids from your §7Void Extractor
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.lubrican: There are multiple ways to make lubricant, maybe you can make use of all that excess creosote.
Best thing for cutting that you can get.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.chemical: Used for a ton of chemical recipes.
ftbquests.industrial_revolution.title: Industrial Revolution
