ftbquests.line_of_progression.perfect_ov: Go Read About Perfect Overclock in the Mechanics chapter
ftbquests.line_of_progression.primitive_: Read About Multiblock Creation and Multiblock Wallsharing in the Mechanics chapter
ftbquests.line_of_progression.electric_m: Read About Overclocking in the Mechanics chapter
ftbquests.line_of_progression.steam_mult: Read About Steam Parallels in the Mechanics chapter
ftbquests.line_of_progression.threading_: Read About Threading in the Mechanics chapter
ftbquests.line_of_progression.boosted_mu: Read About Throughout Boosting in the Mechanics chapter
ftbquests.line_of_progression.title: Line Of Progression
ftbquests.mechanics.multiblocks.descript:
Building your first multiblock may seem daunting, but don't fret as there's an easy guide for any multiblock through EMI!

By looking at the uses of a multiblock controller in EMI, you will be shown every block needed with the amount alongside a physical display that you can look at layer by layer to help you build it.

Most multiblocks can accept multiple input bus/hatches however there is a minimum to casings a machine needs so if yours isn't forming then try replacing some of them with casing.
ftbquests.mechanics.multiblocks.title: Multiblock Creation
ftbquests.mechanics.emi.description:
EMI/JEI has its own integration into GregTech that allows the user to more easily figure out recipes like,

§5-§r The minimum voltage tier of the recipe being on the bottom right
§5-§r Allowing you to see the speed of the recipe at each voltage tier
§5-§r Showing the speeds for Perfect Overclocking
§5-§r Having a preview of every multiblock in the pack

&5- &rKeep in mind that hovering over an item and clicking "r" will should the ways to acquire it and clicking "u" will show uses of it.

&7Make sure to check your keybinds and experiment, it is a &l&nvery&r&7 useful tool.
ftbquests.mechanics.emi.title: EMI/JEI Tricks
ftbquests.mechanics.ghost_circuits.descr:
Many GregTech machines include a circuit configuration window in the bottom-left of the interface. Circuits, ranging from Blank to 32, determine which recipes the machine can process.

To check the required circuit for a recipe, click the arrow between the input and output slots to view the machine's recipe list.

If a recipe shows no circuit or a blank one, select Blank. If it specifies a numbered circuit (e.g., 4), select the corresponding circuit in the configuration window.
ftbquests.mechanics.ghost_circuits.title: Ghost Circuits
ftbquests.mechanics.machine_modes.descri:
Some GregTech machines support multiple modes, which you can switch using the window on the left side of the UI. This allows one machine to perform different tasks.

The first machine you'll encounter with this functionality is the Wooden Barrel

When changing modes, make sure to update the machine (by removing and reinserting inputs) so recipes work correctly.
ftbquests.mechanics.machine_modes.title: Machine Modes
ftbquests.mechanics.parallels.descriptio:
Parallels are a mechanic that allow machines to run multiples of the same recipe at once, dramatically increasing throughput. Though how they work is a little funky.

Parallel Hatches work by consuming the maximum amperage of a tier and using that to determine how many recipes can run in parallel (given your parallel hatch is large enough).

A common misconception is that using two 4A or two 16A hatches to get 8A and 32A respectively will do anything. It won't. All that does is give machines a larger buffer, &4&lNOT&r greater abilities.

§oMore on the §nNext Page

Another thing to note: since multiple recipes run at once, the process will take slightly longer per batch. However, this tradeoff is worthwhile since every 4x increase in parallels nets 2x more efficiency.

An equation to calculate the max number of parallels and time increase at any tier is on the §n§oNext Page§r.

§nEquations§r

Amount of Parallels : min(ParallelCapability, ParallelHatchSize)

(1/(%%amp)) * (4^(#ofOverclocks)) : ParallelCapability

2^(#ofOverclocks) : Time Increase Multiplier of the Recipe

§nKey:§r

%%amp : %% of an amp the recipe consumes at its tier, typically close to 100%% or 50%%, but not always.

#ofOverclocks : The number of voltage tiers your machine's §e§oSpeed§r is above the recipe's required voltage.

ParallelHatchSize = Maximum number of Parallels a Hatch can Perform (4, 16, 64, ...)
ftbquests.mechanics.parallels.title: Parallelization
ftbquests.mechanics.wireless_power.descr:
Dreamlinks are a form of wireless power unique to StarT

The only form of power Dreamlinks accept are lasers. To produce these, use an active transformer.

To transfer power, you need Dream-link Nodes. These provide a kind of reception, that dream link hatches/covers accept.

By putting your Node and Hatch on the same network, they will share power, just like Flux Networks.

Each new tier of node has better range and connection limit than the previous one.

The ranges and max connections are:
- Dream-link Node: 16 Blocks Range \& 16 Connections
- Oneiric Relay: 32 Blocks Range \& 64 Connections
- Daydream Spire: 64 Blocks Range \& Unlimited Connections
- Beacon of Lucidity: Unlimited Range \& Connections
- Paragon of the Veil: Unlimited Range and Cross-Dimensional \& Unlimited Connections
ftbquests.mechanics.wireless_power.title: Wireless Power
ftbquests.mechanics.wall_sharing.descrip:
If you are running low on resources but want to speed up production, you can use one side of an already existing multiblock and build a second one off of it!

You can share almost any blocks in a multiblock including coils and input/output buses and hatches. The item's tooltip will say if a block cannot be shared.
ftbquests.mechanics.wall_sharing.title: Multiblock Wall Sharing
ftbquests.mechanics.distinct_buses.descr:
Worried your multiblock extruder is going to use the wrong cast? Well there's a feature to stop that!

If you enable distinct buses on every input bus on a multiblock then it will separate the ingredients that's stored in each one.
This means that if you insert a material into the bus with a certain cast, it can only ever use that cast and never any in other buses.
ftbquests.mechanics.distinct_buses.title: Distinct Buses
ftbquests.mechanics.overclocking.descrip:
If you put two Energy Hatches onto a multiblock, it will allow you to "Overclock" the machine to the next voltage tier.
This is used quite a lot in the EBF to give you access to the next voltage tier of material but can be used on almost any other multiblock.

Examples of multiblocks that cannot form with two energy hatches is the Circuit and Normal Assembler to not allow progress skipping.
ftbquests.mechanics.overclocking.title: Overclocking
ftbquests.mechanics.perfect_overclocking:
When using a multiblock version of a single block, you have the option to "Perfect Overclock" the machine.
You can access this in the same way as a normal Overclock however it will decrease the processing time even more!

To see the speeds when Perfect Overclocking, do Shift + Left Click on the voltage button on the bottom of the recipe on EMI
ftbquests.mechanics.large_chemical_react:
One benefit of gaining access to the Large Chemical Reactor (LCR) is that you now have access to some chemical skips.

Every recipe in this multiblock that uses Circuit 24 will usually only use the base chemicals which will allow you to compact long chemical lines down into a single machine.

A few examples of this is most acids, and liquid epoxy.
ftbquests.mechanics.lockable_fluid_hatch:
Fluid Output hatches have the power to be locked to only accept a certain fluid. This can be useful in multiblocks like the Large Chemical Reactor and the Distillation Tower which usually will have multiple fluids being made in the same machine.

You can use this to have processing lines without fluids going to the wrong machine or the wrong tank and stopping the machine.
ftbquests.mechanics.superconductors.desc:
Each voltage tier has a cable material that is counted as a super conductor, which means there is no energy loss on a line of cables as well as being able to hold a higher amount of amperage.

These consist of:
§7LV:§r Soul Infused
§bMV:§r Signalum
§6HV:§r Lumium
§5EV:§r Enderium
§9IV:§r Shellite
§dLuV:§r Twinite
§cZPM:§r Dragonsteel
§3UV:§r Prismalium and Melodium
§4UHV:§r Stellarium
§aUEV:§r Ancient Runicalium and Enriched Pallarovium Alloy
§2UIV:§r Rhenium Super-Composite Alloy

§7§lSpecial note:§r
GregTech also adds its own superconductors. These however are much harder to craft, and mostly get ignored because of this.
ftbquests.mechanics.cheaper_circuits.des:
Throughout progression, you may want to check back at older circuit tiers to see if you have gained access to a more efficient recipe.

This could be upgrading from basic components to SMD components or advanced SMD components, or gaining access to a new wafer type that can change the entire recipe.

Not only are these recipes cheaper, but they usually give a much higher quantity per craft for both components AND circuits
&bThroughput Boosting&r is a modifier that machines have which allow them to process more materials at once.

These work like the Electric version of steam parallels with a few caveats.

What are steam parallels?

&7Modifier Logic on the next page

&nHow they work:&r

If a recipe has 4 of a recipe worth of materials in it:

- It will process all &24&r recipes at once

- The duration increases by &c40%%

- The EU/t cost is decreased by &210%%
ftbquests.mechanics.bulking.description:
Machines with this will reward you for running many recipes at once.

The bonus for Bulking is progressively linear meaning it scales up as you give it more recipes / power.

&nFunctionality:&r

- If a recipe has 4 recipes in it, then it runs all &a4&r recipes and &4triples&r the duration.

- This scales up to &a64x&r recipes at once for only a &448x&r increase in time.

- A net &a33%%&r increase in efficiency.
ftbquests.mechanics.bulking.title: Bulking
ftbquests.mechanics.steam_parallels.desc: While consuming more steam than their earlier counter-parts (if at all), they are able to run multiple of the same recipe at once with no extra cost or time making it a great feature for bulk processing early on.
ftbquests.mechanics.threading.descriptio:
Threading is the absolute tier of machine capabilities which gives choice to the player on how their machine benefits.

Think of threading as a Stat Point system, by which investing points into different "stats" you are able to get different benefits.

These stats are given to you by the Helixes that you place on the machine and you attribute them using the controller present.

&nThe Stats:

- Generalis: &7Stats which can be attributed to any of the 4 other stats 

- &aVelocitas&r: &7Stats used to reduce the recipe duration of machines

- &dEfficienta&r: &7Stats used to reduce the EU/t cost of machines

- &cParallelismus&r: &7Stats used to give your machines parallels

- &9Filum&r: &7Stats used to Multi-thread your machines

&aVelocitas&r Benfits:

&7Halve the recipe duration for every (sum of halvings * 100) points

&nExample:

- To halve the duration once is 100 points for &a50%%&r duration reduction.
&7 100 = (100 * [1])
- To halve it twice is 300 points for &a75%%&r duration reduction.
&7 300 = (100 * [2+1])
- To halve it 3 times is 600 points for &a87.5%%&r duration reduction.
&7 600 = (100 * [3+2+1])

&dEfficienta&r Benfits:

&7For every 30 points gain another thread worth of energy reduction

&nExample:

- 30 points is 50%% EU/t cost or 1/2 cost
- 60 points is 66.6%% EU/t cost or 1/3 cost
- 90 points is 75%% EU/t cost or 1/4 cost

&cParallelismus&r Benefits:

Gain 1 additional parallel per 20 points invested, but at the cost of increasing duration by sqrt(Parallels)

&nExample:

- 20 points is 2 total parallels at a cost of ~41%% more duration
&7 ~41%% increase = sqrt(2)
- 60 points is 4 total parallels at a cost of 100%% more duration
&7 100%% increase = sqrt(4)

&9Filum&r Benefits:

Gain 1 additional multi-thread per 5 points invested. Multi-threads allow you to run additional types of recipes at once.

&nExample:

- 1 multi-thread allows you to run 2 different type of recipes at once, but it does add the EU/t cost of the 2 recipes for the machine
&7 (Tungsten Plate AND Titanium Plate at the same time)

- 3 multi-threads allows you to run 4 different recipes types but their EU/t cost increases to the sum of the 4 recipes
ftbquests.mechanics.threading.title: Threading
ftbquests.mechanics.title: Mechanics
ftbquests.mystical_agriculture_gregified:
Grow your resources instead

Currently best used for Nether Stars and Airs

Both Lithium Persulfate Dust and Sodium Persulfate Dust can be additionally required by using the opposing liquid allowing you to recycle the catalyst infinitely as long as the respective Lithium/Sodium is available.
ftbquests.power.stirling_dynamo.descript:
The Stirling dynamo is a furnace that generates power.

It consumes furnace fuels, and gives power in exchange. Although it is not a strong source of energy, it is an easy and relatively cheap generator, making it a popular choice for people who want to quickly get some power for LV.
ftbquests.power.empty_tier_iii_battery.d:
This is the final capacitor container.

It can be used for the UV and UHV capacitors, which includes the Ultimate Capacitor.
ftbquests.power.empty_tier_iii_battery.s: The third and final tier of capacitor containers
ftbquests.power.empty_tier_ii_battery.de: This one can be used to craft the LuV and ZPM capacitors.
ftbquests.power.empty_tier_ii_battery.su: The second tier of capacitor containers
ftbquests.power.empty_tier_i_battery.des:
The first of three capacitor containers or hulls.

This one is used for EV and IV capacitors.
ftbquests.power.empty_tier_i_battery.sub: The first tier of capacitor containers
ftbquests.power.lv_power.title: §7LV§r Power
ftbquests.power.mv_power.title: §bMV§r Power
ftbquests.power.hv_power.title: §6HV§r Power
ftbquests.power.ev_power.title: §5EV§r Power
ftbquests.power.iv_power.title: §9IV§r Power
ftbquests.power.luv_power.title: §dLuV§r Power
ftbquests.power.zpm_power.title: §cZPM§r Power
ftbquests.power.uv_power.title: §3UV§r Power
ftbquests.power.uhv_power.title: §4UHV§r Power
ftbquests.power.uev_power.title: §aUEV§r Power
ftbquests.power.uiv_power.title: §2UIV§r Power
ftbquests.power.dont_worry_about_it.desc:
§l§4I said not to worry about it.§r

- §oKindest Regards,
     §o§3§mThe Remover of Spines
ftbquests.power.boilers.description:
By right-clicking a thermal dynamo with a Steam Pipe you can convert it into a Boiler.

Boilers produce steam instead of energy, and you can use this steam to power steam generators.

Thermal offers you the Steam Dynamo, and GT offers Steam Turbines to convert steam into energy.
ftbquests.power.boilers.subtitle: Generates twice as much as dynamos
ftbquests.power.boilers.title: Boilers \§ the Steam Dynamo
ftbquests.power.nuclear_reactor.descript: Parallels can make it scale just a "little".
ftbquests.power.thermal_dynamos.descript:
Thermal Dynamos are cheaper than GregTech energy generation machines.
Thermal Dynamos can be upgraded.
Depending on the upgrades installed, you can get more power from a fuel than GregTech generators.
Best for early game up to mid game.
ftbquests.power.thermal_dynamos.title: Why use Thermal Dynamos?
ftbquests.power.solar.description: While expensive to make and not your best source it is free energy from the §e§lSUN§r.
ftbquests.power.solar.title: What is Solar?
ftbquests.power.supreme_plasma_turbine.d:
The Supreme Plasma Turbine is a beast of a machine, capable of generating insane amounts of power.

The main focus of the SPT is reducing the spam of plasma turbines. In exchange for the insane amounts of power produced, it eats through an equally insane amount of plasma.

The SPT is most definitely worth it, especially if you apply coolant boosting.

§4Note:§7 If the Machine has issues forming, break and re-place the controller
ftbquests.power.solar_panel_8.descriptio: A compressed form of the T7 solar panel, to reduce the lag produced by large amounts of solar panels.
ftbquests.power.gregtech_generators.desc:
GregTech generators have more variety.
Higher tier generators can generate much more energy per tick than Thermal Dynamos.
Best for late mid-game and end game.
ftbquests.power.large_plasma_turbine.des:
Plasma Turbines can use the heat of plasma's to generate large amounts of energy.

By using fusion reactors, you can generate a variety of plasma's, each with different energy efficiencies.
ftbquests.power.lapidary_dynamo.descript:
Lapidary Dynamo's are a popular source of power. Most people power them with diamonds, and supply those with mechanical sieves.

They can take you quite far if you keep upgrading them, especially if you turn them into Boilers later on.
ftbquests.power.steam_turbine.descriptio:
A simple Turbine that turns steam into energy.

Get steam by using boilers from either GT or Thermal.
ftbquests.power.combustion.description:
Combustion Generators burn a variety of fuels to produce energy.

Most of these fuels are easily mass producible if you have oil processing up and running.

If you do not have oil processing, consider looking into Biodiesel instead
§7Keep in mind that combustion generators only accept GT Biodiesel, because the Crude Biodiesel produced by create is not refined enough to be used in these machines.
ftbquests.power.gas_turbine.description:
Gas Turbines are slightly more advanced turbines that generate energy using various gases.

The most popular choice of these is Nitrobenzene. If you are interested in using Gas Turbines to power your base, check it out.
ftbquests.power.mci_kit.description: Multi-Cycle Injectors (MCI's for short) boost the fuel efficiency of your Dynamo's, making them consume less fuel.
ftbquests.power.compression_dynamo.descr: The Compression Dynamo is Thermals equivalent of the Combustion Generator from GT.
ftbquests.power.arc_kit.description: Auxiliary Reaction Chambers (ARC's for short) boost the maximum energy generation of a Dynamo at the cost of fuel efficiency.
ftbquests.power.redstone_flux_cell.descr:
The Redstone Flux Cell is a simple way to store some of your excess RF in the early game.
It can be upgraded using upgrade kits, and RF coil kits.
ftbquests.power.rfc_kit.description: Expanded RF Coils (RFC's for short) provide a medium-sized boost to both energy transfer limits and the internal energy capacity of a flux cell.
ftbquests.power.rfs_kit.description: Stabilized RF Coils (RFS' for short) provide a large boost to the internal energy capacity of a flux cell at the cost of a lower boost to energy transfer limits.
ftbquests.power.rft_kit.description: High-flux RF Coils (RFT's for short) provide a large boost to energy transfer limits of a flux cell at the cost of a lower boost to the internal energy capacity.
ftbquests.power.laser_transfer.descripti:
Active Transformers can send and receive lasers.

They accept both laser and substation hatches, and act as a transformer between "normal" EU and lasers.

These lasers can carry extremely large amounts of energy, at the cost of needing Active Transformers to both turn corners and convert lasers into usable energy.
ftbquests.power.basic_energy_core.descri: The first of many energy cores. The later tiers of these take a while to make, so it is advised you plan your production of them if you are gonna rely on solar for power.
ftbquests.power.flux_dust.description: The base ingredient for all flux networks components, giving you access to wireless power.
ftbquests.power.flux_controller.descript:
The controller, although not necessary for your flux network to operate, allows you to use wireless charging.

No longer will you fall out of the sky because of empty jetboots, or lose access to AE2 because your terminal ran out of power.
ftbquests.power.basic_flux_storage.descr: A small amount of wireless power storage.
ftbquests.power.flux_plug.description: Flux plugs are the input nodes of your flux network. They take energy from converters and generators and store it in the... energy cloud?
ftbquests.power.flux_point.description: Flux points are the output nodes of your flux network, that provide your machines and converters with power.
ftbquests.power.herculean_flux_storage.d: A slightly bigger storage for your wireless power.
A medium sized amount of storage, perfect for storing energy until you get access to the substation.
ftbquests.power.diatrons.description: Diatrons are the best lapidary dynamo fuel. Even the lowest tier of diatrons has energy-positive production!
ftbquests.power.diatrons.title: Diatrons
ftbquests.power.upgrade_kit.description:
Upgrade Kits boost all stats of thermal machines.

Some machines that might benefit from these upgrades are:
- Aqueous Accumulators
- Dynamo's and Boilers
- Redstone Flux Cells
- Igneous Extruders
- Fluid Cells
ftbquests.power.rotor_holder_oc.descript:
On top of its inherent &b10%% efficiency bonus&r &7([1-.1] or .9 or 90%% fuel consumption)&r, each tier up of rotor holder doubles consumption and power giving you a &62x energy&r output for 1.8x more fuel. It is always worth it if you can supply enough fuel.

In other words, it doubles parallels and gives more efficiency.
ftbquests.power.rotor_holder_oc.title: Rotor Holder OCs
ftbquests.power.rotor_holders.title: Rotor Holders
ftbquests.power.carbon_brushes.descripti:
Generator Coils generate electricity by using a magnetic field. The faster they spin, the more FE/t they will generate, but with higher SU costs.

The Carbon Brushes must touch one of the coils in order to store the energy.
ftbquests.power.magnets.description:
Magnets are what actually makes your coils generate power. Higher Magnetic force means higher FE generation, at the cost of an increase in SU usage.

To calculate the amount of FE you produce, and how much SU that will take, you can use the following formulas:

FE/t : RPM*MF/20
SU : RPM*(MF+24)

RPM: the rotational speed of the coil
MF: the sum of the magnetic force of all magnets that influence the coil
ftbquests.power.new_age_wires.descriptio: Early power transfer over long distances but can be limited.
ftbquests.power.title: Power
ftbquests.preparing_for_dimensional_trav: Sentience in a circuit.

ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.propene_: This recipe is the easiest to make.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.polyviny: A polymer used to coat materials making them more secure.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.nether_s:
A singular §o§dNether Star§r can be broken down into 5 shards. Using this you can more cheaply loop them.

With an Autoclave at §9IV§r, you can higher chances at getting your elemental infused shards by using the nether star shards and energizing them in a Polarizer.

At §4UHV§r you can guarantee infused shards by using energized elemental fluids, which you can get from fusion reactors.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.polydime: While we acknowledge that there are many methods to making this, this one is shown as an example
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.perfect_: Once you reach the Nether, you can create the most efficient Nether Star line using your §2UIV§r tier autoclave and the nether tempered elemental fluids, where, not only are you guaranteed to get infused shards, but have a chance to get extra!
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.sulfuric: Sulfuric acid is used in a ton of recipes. Once you have sufficient resource generation, automating this on passive is a must.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.aluminiu: Sodalite and Clay electrolysis are both great ways to automate this once you have §bMV§r electrolyzers
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.rutile.d: Processing Ilmenite or Bauxite gives Rutile as byproduct, and you can electrolyze the Bauxite dust or process Ilmenite for more Rutile yield.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.spurifie: By electrolyzing the Purified Debris Dust that you get you are able to obtain the Debris Dust to kick off the processing chain again, thus looping the system.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.electron: Electron with Electron yields the most
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.muon_inj: Muon with Muon yields the most
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.tau_inje: Tau with Tau yields the most
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.leptonic:
While not needed yet, if you balance all the Akreyrium Variants you can recombine them and process down Lepton Dense Akreyrium for the highest yields.


Next Level Akreyrium
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.bacteria: This entire processing line requires a Sterile Cleanroom
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.meat_dus: Try using the Aquatic Entangler to automate this. If it is too slow, you can upgrade it with the Upgrade Kits you made before. These increase the amount of fish per catch by quite a bit.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.zirconiu: An element with excellent resistance against a number of factors. Made by processing Abydos Titanite-rich Magma
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.zapolgiu: A material gotten by processing Abydos Zapolite-rich Magma
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.silicon_: A semiconductor worthy of this technology
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.naquadah: Naquadah and its family tree of materials will now be used everywhere, so you better passive the Naquadah line asap.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.telluriu: A new element, that opens up the possibility for new materials.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.steriliz: The medium used to grow life.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.echo_sha: Where did those voices come from...
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.sterile_: The medium used to grow life.
ftbquests.processing_lines_chap.pedot_ps: Only the longest of polymer names

ftbquests.quality_of_life.toms_storage.d: A great way to interface with your storage prior to AE2
ftbquests.quality_of_life.routers.descri: From being a fake player to wirelessly sorting your base it can do a LOT
ftbquests.quality_of_life.gt_tools.descr:
This tool can both help you do more and MOST notably build multiblock for you by shift right clicking a controller with the blocks in your inventory.

Machine Memory copys single block configurations

Portable scanner gives info on blocks clicked (helps with multi info)

ftbquests.quality_of_life.item_collector: Vrooom, vacuums up all your items
ftbquests.quality_of_life.backpacks.desc: A good way to increase your personal inventory

With an §5EV§r Mixer you can recycle those extra ores for some more §7Molten Ore Mixture§r, with an §9IV§r Mixer you can start looping that §8Metal Mixture§r that you get.

A Large Mixer or Large Mixing Vessel is Recommended for the Job.

ftbquests.welcome.lore.description:
Red screens flash and alarms are going off. Everyone in the room is evacuating. The experiment is a failure. There is little time before this building will explode. But you notice something... the gate ... is opening! You stare in awe and think: "Yes! My theories were right and I figured out what was the problem!". You don't notice the others calling out to you to run. But it was too late. A failure is still a failure and the gate engulfs everything in the room.

You wake up stranded on a floating island in an alternate dimension. The only things you have is a tree and some dirt around it. But you are not discouraged. As the world's greatest scientist you can use these materials to develop technology at faster rate than anyone. You can try once again interdimensional travel. For that you will have to make from almost nothing everything, to develop up to draconic and even star technology. You §oWILL§r succeed. You §oWILL§r return home.

    §lWelcome to Star Technology.§r
ftbquests.welcome.lore.title: Lore
§cALPHA 1§r (Initial Release): Gameplay is in a working state. Theoretically it should be able to reach UHV. Done an initial gregification of some mods. No end game content yet.

§cALPHA 1 HOTFIX 1§r: fixed nickel being gated behind LV

§cALPHA 1 HOTFIX 2§r: Updated some mods and added red alloy dust recipe

§cALPHA 2:§r Fixed some recipes. Rearranged    and changed some quests. Fixed missing lang names of custom recipe types. Added the tree greenhouse multiblock. Added the primitive alloy smelter. Added the kinetic ore factory. Added some mods like thermal dynamics, thermal systeamics, and simply lights. Overhauled the early game.

§cALPHA 2 HOTFIX 1:§r Added the missing steam dynamo recipe. Fixed the structure of the Tree Green House. Modified the structure of quests.

§cALPHA 3:§r Added the Large Barrel multiblock. Added some quests. Added graphite, fluiduct, windowed fluiduct, servo attachment and turbo servo attachment recipes. Changed crushed blackstone recipe from forge hammer to macerator.

§cALPHA 3 HOTFIX 1:§rFixed missing gravel recipe in forge hammer. Changed sieving gem recipes from gem to crushed ore.

§cBeta 1:§r Added the following mods: Travel Anchors, Functional Storage, Item Collectors, Carry On. Made dynamos, arc upgrade, mic upgrade and components cheaper.    Buffed the Tree Greenhouse. Slightly nerfed the Extreme Reactors recipes.

§9Stargate 1 content§r: Added 6 new multiblocks. Added recipes related to the first stargate. Added appropriate quests.

§cBeta 2§r: Updated Forge version. Added the following mods: Architect's Palette, 'Dustrial Decor, Simple Discord RPC. Fixed Electrico-Kinetic Ore Factory. Fixed some langs. Added quests chapter Quality of Life.

§cBeta 2 HOTFIX 1:§r Removed Simple Discord RPC. Fixed soul infused ingots. Made slight modifications to Quality of Life Chapter. Buffed dynamo energy generation. Made dynamo upgrades even cheaper. Added a new panorama.

§cBeta 2 HOTFIX 2:§r Re-added vanadium magnetite to sieving

§cBeta 3:§r Fixed some typos in quests. Added new quests. Tweaked the color of some casings. Tweaked lumium color. Fixed soul infused ingots recipe in Primitive Alloy Smelter. Added alloy smelter recipe for soul infused ingots. Fixed lithium perchlorate recipe. Fixed saltpeter essence burning in cryptand recipe. Fixed not being able to place blocks in Kinetic Ore Factory's area. Limited colossal chests to 5x5x5. Made nether/end agglomeratio recipes take less time. Fixed Electrico-Kinetic Ore Factory infaltion issue. removed shapeless recipe for bronze and brass. Added magnetite to sieving and ore factories. Increased duration of slime spores production in Large barrel. Modified dynamo upgrades. Added new multiblock Large Stone Barrel for lava, obsidian and pebble production. Fixed netherite sieve upgrade taking HV circuits instead of IV circuits. Added crushed diamond and emerald ore to sieving. Modified create goggle recipes.
Added the following mods: Jet Boots, Pipez, Create New Age, Ender Chests, Ender Tanks, Iris and Oculus Flywheel Compat, NuclearCraft: Neoteric, Daily Dad, Forgiving Void, CraftPresence, Embeddium++.
Removed the following mods: Thermal Dynamics, Automobility, Create Slice 'n' Dice, Create Armory, Ender Storage, Extreme Reactors, Let Sleeping Dogs Lie, Modern UI, Packaged Auto, PackagedExCrafting, Ensorcellation, Corpse.
Updated the following mods: Curios API, Cyclops Core, Embeddium, FTB Quests, GTCEu Modern, Jade, Kotlin for Forge, ModernFix, Mystical Agriculture, Not Enough Crashes, Supermartijn642's Core Lib, Thermal Extra.

§cBeta 3 HOTFIX1:§r Fixed broken charges recipes. Fixed unreasonable RMPs for the Electrico-Kinetic Ore Factory. Added a way to convert NuclearCraft plutonium239 and plutonium241 to their GregTech material. Removed coke to graphite recipe. Buffed chance for nether star essence in its recipe. Changed emerald and diamond crushed ore from string mesh to flint mesh.

§cBeta 3 HOTFIX 2:§r Changed carbon brushes recipe from coke to charcoal. Added Create Diesel Generators to fix the impossibility to make a proper create steam engine. Added recipe for create belts from rubber. Reduced durations of several thermal augments. Added press recipes for some materials. Changed ender pouch recipe from leather to carbon fiber plates.

§cBeta 3 HOTFIX 3:§r Added the mod Load My F***ing Tags. Fixed several recipes using double plates. Fixed NuclearCraft fuel recipes. Fixed some mystical agriculture recipes. Fixed stirling dynamo recipe.
§l§bChangelogs after beta 3 are available on the official discord server.§r§r
ftbquests.welcome.changelog.title: Developer Log
ftbquests.welcome.discord.description:
We have an official discord server:
§o§bhttps://discord.com/invite/startechnology§r

In here you can ask for help, report issues and make suggestions.

We are lucky to have a large active community, who are always willing to help, and create some insanely helpful guides.

This questbook keeps most information at a surface level, and serves more so as an introduction to all that StarT has to offer than a comprehensive and detailed guide of all systems.

For those things, we heavily recommend you check out the #guides channel in the discord.
